message.content:
cs.IT, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with network information theory, which is a subfield of information theory that focuses on the study of information transmission over networks. Therefore, cs.IT (Information Theory) is the most likely sub-category. The paper also discusses the treatment of sources, channels, states, and side information in a unified way, which falls under the scope of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). The paper also mentions constraints such as cost and distortion constraints, which are related to optimization problems and can be categorized under cs.CC (Computational Complexity). The paper also discusses the use of new proof techniques beyond the use of standard covering and packing lemmas, which can be related to cs.MM (Mathematical Methods). Finally, the paper defines and characterizes three types of network duality, which can be related to cs.SI (Systems and Control).
